Unfortunately, this was one of the worst shawarmas I‚Äôve ever had.
First of all, it had no flavor ‚Äî the meat was dry, barely any sauce, and the vegetables weren‚Äôt fresh.
Second, the portion was tiny ‚Äî definitely not enough to satisfy even a small appetite.

To make things worse, the customer service was terrible ‚Äî no greeting, no thank you, just a rude attitude like I was bothering them.

Definitely not recommended. Total waste of money and time.

Fresh food, amazing service, 10/10 experience.

I got the chicken gyro on Turkish bread, appetizer platter and couldn‚Äôt be happier with the money spent.

Every flavor was fresh distinct and vibrant in the sandwich although not overpowering in any direction, the bread was freshly baked and the meat seared to perfection.

Will 10000% be back.

Little Istanbul Restaurant is a true gem for Turkish cuisine lovers! The atmosphere is cozy and relaxing, with beautiful decor reminiscent of Istanbul's views. The food is absolutely amazing: the dishes are prepared with care, the meat is juicy and flavorful, the fries are crispy, and the salad is fresh and appetizing. The variety of dishes is impressive, and you can feel the quality of the ingredients in every bite. The service is fast and friendly. A special bonus is the late hours, as the restaurant is open until 4 AM. I highly recommend this place for a hearty meal and a great experience!

The restaurant is located in the Homecrest section of Brooklyn.  They prepare Turkish cuisine.  I ordered the large chicken adana platter.  The platter included two adanas over salad and rice.  The large kofte platter included five pieces over salad and rice.  The platters were accompanied with several sauces and one pita bread.  An additional pita bread for each platter would be desirable.  The pita bread was rolled up in aluminum foil and not easy to chew.  The rice pudding desert was good but sweet.

Little Istanbul, nestled on Avenue U in Brooklyn, offers a commendable foray into Turkish cuisine, capturing the essence of Istanbul‚Äôs vibrant food scene. The restaurant‚Äôs ambiance is unpretentious, focusing attention squarely on its culinary offerings.

The Adana Kebab stands out‚Äîa skewer of seasoned lamb, grilled to perfection, delivering robust flavors reminiscent of Turkish street fare. Equally noteworthy is the Kunefe, a dessert marrying crisp pastry with soft cheese, drizzled in sweet syrup‚Äîa harmonious blend of textures and tastes.

Service is efficient, with staff extending warm hospitality, including gestures like complimentary Turkish tea, enhancing the dining experience.  However, certain dishes, such as the chicken kebab, have room for improvement in flavor depth and preparation consistency.

In essence, Little Istanbul provides a satisfying and authentic taste of Turkish cuisine in Brooklyn, meriting a four-star rating for its standout dishes and genuine service.

Little Istanbul Restaurant is a hidden gem in Brooklyn that offers a genuine taste of Turkish cuisine and hospitality. What started as a quick stop for a bite turned into an unexpectedly delightful dining experience that left me completely satisfied and eager to return.

Ambiance and Atmosphere
The restaurant has a warm, inviting atmosphere that strikes the perfect balance between modern decor and authentic Turkish charm. From the moment you step in, you‚Äôre transported to a cozy spot reminiscent of the eateries I‚Äôve visited in Turkey.

Food Experience
Lamb Platter:
The lamb platter was the highlight of my meal. Perfectly seasoned and cooked to tender perfection, the lamb was flavorful and juicy, paired with fluffy rice and a side of fresh salad. The seasoning felt authentic, with hints of Turkish spices that immediately brought back memories of my trip to Turkey.

Beverages:
I opted for a Ginger Ale to accompany the main course, which added a refreshing touch to the meal. However, the real treat was the Turkish-style tea I had at the end. Served in a traditional tulip-shaped glass, the tea was robust and aromatic‚Äîa true testament to Turkish hospitality.

Dessert - Tres Leches:
The tres leches was the perfect indulgence to wrap up my meal. While not traditionally Turkish, it was rich and creamy without being overly sweet, demonstrating the restaurant's ability to excel beyond its core cuisine.

Take-Home Pizza:
I couldn‚Äôt resist taking a box of their pizza home. It was fresh, cheesy, and loaded with toppings. Even reheated later, it tasted fantastic, showing how much care they put into every dish.

Service
The staff was attentive and friendly, always ensuring I was comfortable and had everything I needed. They were happy to share recommendations and made the experience feel personal and welcoming.

Final Thoughts
Little Istanbul is more than just a restaurant; it‚Äôs an experience that brings Turkish flavors and culture to Brooklyn. The combination of expertly prepared dishes, nostalgic touches, and exceptional service makes this place a standout. Whether you‚Äôre stopping by for a quick meal or planning a full dinner, it‚Äôs worth every moment and every bite.

I‚Äôm already looking forward to my next visit!

Due to a change of routes, my friend and I ended up coming to Little Istanbul Restaurant. Despite its small size the atmosphere, customer service, and taste of food left a great impact.

Over the phone and in person customer service was excellent. Waiters and managers greeted us as we entered the store. When we asked for recommendations they kindly guided as needed.

Food delivery took an appropriate amount of time and were proportioned well for the amount spent. Each dish was well cooked, fresh, and had no bad after taste.

While eating, we were amazed at the decor of the restaurant.

This is one of my new go tos for Turkish food.

I ordered the regular Chicken Shish Kebab rice platter for $15 (including tax).

Small portions with little meat, the chicken was a little overcooked, and the sauces did not improve the flavor by much.

For $15 dollars, I'm expecting a lot more.

As a Turkish person living in New York, finding authentic Turkish food can be tough, but Little Istanbul in Brooklyn is a rare gem. The cozy, authentic decor and friendly staff made us feel at home right away.

We enjoyed the mixed kebab and Adana platters, both grilled to perfection. The baklava for dessert, paired with complimentary Turkish tea, was a delightful touch.

Though it‚Äôs a bit far from where I live, I‚Äôll definitely be coming back and highly recommend it to anyone looking for real Turkish flavors.

Oh, let me tell you about Little Istanbul in Brooklyn ‚Äì it's like stepping into a Turkish delight factory, but with more kebabs and fewer calories! üç¢‚ú®

First things first, the **Adana Kebab** here is the stuff of legends. Imagine a skewer of perfectly spiced, juicy meat that makes your taste buds do a happy dance. It's like a flavor explosion in your mouth, and trust me, you'll be dreaming about it for days.

But don't just stop at the kebabs! Kick off your culinary adventure with some fresh-cooked falafel or a mixed appetizer platter. It's like a party on your plate, and everyone's invited. The falafel is crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and the mixed appetizers are a delightful medley of flavors that will have you saying "yum" with every bite.

Next up, dive into the kebab platters. These are not just meals; they're experiences. Each platter is a masterpiece, with succulent meats and perfectly grilled veggies that will make you wonder why you ever ate anything else.

And then there's the **Lahmacun** ‚Äì think of it as a Turkish pizza, but way cooler. It's a thin-crusted, oven-baked delight topped with savory minced meat and spices. One bite, and you'll be hooked.

Feeling adventurous? Order the lamb gyro with special aromatic rice. The lamb is tender and flavorful, and the rice is so aromatic, you'll want to bottle the scent and wear it as perfume.

Now, for the grand finale: the hot and cheesy **Kunafe**. This dessert is like a warm hug from the inside out. It's gooey, cheesy, and sweet ‚Äì the perfect ending to a perfect meal. Pair it with a cup of famous Turkish tea, and you'll be in dessert heaven.

And let's not forget the service! The staff at Little Istanbul are so warm and welcoming, you'll feel like you're dining with family. They're attentive, friendly, and always ready with a smile or a joke.

Best of all, the prices are so reasonable, you'll feel like you got away with a steal. So, if you're in Brooklyn and craving some authentic Turkish cuisine, head over to Little Istanbul. Your taste buds will thank you, and you might just leave with a new favorite restaurant. ü•ô‚ù§Ô∏è

Afiyet olsun! (That's Turkish for "enjoy your meal!")

Excellent and authentic Turkish/Mediterranean food! You would not be disappointed. The food, ambience, and even the Customer Service aspect are tens across-the-board. All the employees are Turkish and they all seem very courteous, welcoming, hospitable, and considerate although their English isn‚Äôt 100%, their Prowess when it comes to providing excellent Turkish food and customer accommodation is top-notch! Prices are very reasonable too!

This place serves up delicious Turkish cuisine with a smile. I had the Yogurtlu Adana, the Hydari, and the Sheppards salad. All were exceptional and worthy of letting everyone I know about this great place I discovered on avenue U.
By the way, you have not had baklava until you have had it at Little Istanbul. It was not overly sweet, just sweet enoy to allow you to still enjoy all the other flavors.  Thank you to the great staff, you made us feel at home.

A Cozy Turkish Spot with the Best Gyro in Town!
This small Turkish restaurant is an absolute treasure, friendly staff and the inviting atmosphere. the gyro. Hands down, it‚Äôs the best I‚Äôve ever had. The meat was perfectly seasoned and juicy, with a crispy edge that gave it just the right texture. Served in crispy lavash, with fresh toppings and a flavorful sauce‚Äîit was perfection in every bite. You can tell it's made with authentic techniques and a lot of love.
If you‚Äôre craving real Turkish food and a gyro that will blow you away, this is the place. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back‚Äîand bringing friends!

While passing, after many years thru my old boyhood town,
I found this delicious little late night spot for Halal food.
I absolutely loved the lamb gyro wrap.
And Tress leches cake !!!
Also great  staff, who offered me tea afterwards.
Thanks !

When I informed staff I was lactose intolerant, they very helpfully recommended dishes I could order.
Results were as pictured- lentil soup, stuffed grape leaves (dessert type, no raisins but no meat and cold), meat adana with rice, side salad and bread.
First time there- good delicious but know not to order as much.

Food was delicious. Cannot recommend this place enough. The atmosphere was like I was literally in Turkey: people around me speaking Turkish, the tea was strong and flavorful (didn't have to ask for refills, staff was on point) and the decor including a chandelier from the byzantine empire was cool.  The lamb kebab was A1. I could have eaten 3 of these plates.  A but pricy but I didn't make it in time for the lunch special. I'll definitely be back again!

Best Turkish restaurant ,Best service ever and foods very delicious I like this place , Good atmosphere and very respectful peoples working in this restaurant . They gave to my baby nuggets and french fries as a compliment . I was shocked )They are very friendly

Such a nice place.  Normally I would just talk about the food, but the decor, ambience, cleanliness and service were on point!

Onto the food. We had the lamb gyro and lahmacun.  Both tasted really good and for the price, the portions were quite generous.  We'll be back to try the pide and Iskender kebab.
